subject: Politics
title: The Taiwan Strait
description: A quick, practical guide to The Taiwan Strait.

hook.text: China claims Taiwan. Taiwan governs itself. The 100-mile strait between them is the world's most dangerous water.

buildup.text: Taiwan has governed itself since 1949. China has never ruled it but claims sovereignty over the island.

discovery.text: The US doesn't formally recognize Taiwan but sells it weapons. This 'strategic ambiguity' keeps tensions in check.

twist.text: China's military buildup suggests it's preparing options. A blockade or invasion would trigger a global crisis.

climax.text: A Taiwan conflict would crash the global economy. Chip shortages alone would devastate every major industry.

punchline.text: Taiwan is where economics, ideology, and geography collide at once.

quiz.question: What is 'strategic ambiguity' regarding Taiwan?
options: The US doesn't formally recognize Taiwan but maintains unofficial support and arms sales
Taiwan has joined the United Nations as a full member
